alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:03PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Cache and Rich Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 503 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Franklin, or 13 miles southeast of Preston, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Logan, Randolph, Laketown, Smithfield, Hyrum, Garden City, Woodruff, Garden, Utah State University, Bear Lake, North Logan, Providence, Nibley, Hyde Park, Richmond, Millville, River Heights, Paradise, Beaver Mountain and Avon. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on Bear Lake. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. This includes the following highways... US Route 89 between mile markers 459 and 502. Utah Route 30 between mile markers 110 and 135. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North
